   .. py:method:: struc_sel(default_selection = None, to2D = True, frame_index = 0)

      Create an initial StructureSelection object from a dataset using the entire structural information in it.

      :param frame (xr.Dataset): Should only represent a single frame of data (i.e. no 'frame' dimension or of zero-size).
      :param default_selection (Sequence[FeatureLevelOptions]: List of features to activate as selected by default. Defaults to [ 'atoms', 'bonds', ].
      :param optional): List of features to activate as selected by default. Defaults to [ 'atoms', 'bonds', ].
      :param to2D (bool: Flag to control whether a mol representation is converted to a 2d projection before use for visualization.
      :param optional): Flag to control whether a mol representation is converted to a 2d projection before use for visualization.
      :param frame_index: Used to select a single frame (using ``.isel()``) if an object containing multiple frames is provided;
                          by default, the first frame is used.

      :raises ValueError: If no structural information could be extracted from the dataset

      :returns: A structure selection object initially covering all atoms and structural features.
      :rtype: StructureSelection

      .. rubric:: Notes

      The dataset (single frame) to extract the structure information out of must have
      at least an `atXYZ` variable and a `atom` dimension.
      Ideally, an `atom` coordinate for feature selection is also provided.
